alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wayne and southwestern McCreary Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parmleysville, or 11 miles south of Monticello, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Griffin and Kidds Crossing around 315 PM EDT. Great Meadows Campsites and Slavens around 320 PM EDT. Co-Operative around 325 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Blue Heron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
